feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 1:17PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WATER EXPECTED TO CONTINUE IN THE SUSITNA BASIN... High water levels can be expected to continue on the Susitna River and its tributaries through the next several days. This includes the Talkeetna, Yentna, Skwentna, Kashwitna and Little Susitna Rivers and associated streams such as Willow, Montana and Moose Creeks. Heavy rainfall over the past week has pushed river

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 12:39PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED WATER LEVELS EXPECTED FOR KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT... TONIGHT`S THREAT: Persistent west-southwesterly flow today into tonight coinciding with high tide and higher seas could raise water levels 1 to 2 feet above normal highest tide, especially between Newtok and Kipnuk.

The combination of low relative humidity values, temperatures in the 90s, breezy southerly winds and drought conditions will result in elevated fire weather conditions this afternoon across western, southwest and central Wisconsin. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 3:24AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS TODAY... A combination of warming temperatures, low relative humidity, and southerly winds gusting to around 20 mph will bring elevated fire weather conditions to portions of central and southwest Wisconsin today.
